glsa.title: lighttpd: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in lighttpd may lead to information disclosure or a Denial of Service.

background.p: lighttpd is a lightweight high-performance web server.

description.p: Julien Cayzax discovered that an insecure default setting exists in mod_userdir in lighttpd. When userdir.path is not set the default value used is $HOME. It should be noted that the "nobody" user's $HOME is "/" (CVE-2008-1270). An error also exists in the SSL connection code which can be triggered when a user prematurely terminates his connection (CVE-2008-1531).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit the first vulnerability to read arbitrary files. The second vulnerability can be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service by terminating a victim's SSL connection.

workaround.p: As a workaround for CVE-2008-1270 you can set userdir.path to a sensible value, e.g. "public_html".
